summary: The Lion Monument, or the Lion of Lucerne, is a famous rock sculpture in Switzerland. Designed by Bertel Thorvaldsen and created in 1820-1821, it honors the Swiss Guards who died during the French Revolution in 1792. About 1.4 million tourists visit it each year. Mark Twain described it as a "mournful and moving" artwork. The monument is protected by Swiss law.
title: Lion Monument
